Global Smart Building Automation Systems Market Synopsis

The Global Smart Building Automation Systems Market is expected to witness a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 11.3% in terms of value during the forecast period of 2021-2026 and reach a market size of USD 72.8 billion by 2026. This is according to a recently published market research report by Verified Market Reports.

A Smart Building Automation System is an integrated system of hardware and software that is used to collect data from various building components, such as temperature, lighting, and energy management, and then to use that data to run the entire building. The system enables users to analyze, control, and customize the building’s operations, leading to improved energy efficiency, better occupant comfort, and cost savings. Smart Building Automation Systems can also be integrated with other systems, such as security, access control, and audio-visual systems.

The Global Smart Building Automation Systems market is rapidly growing due to the rising demand for energy efficient, cost-effective, and secure buildings. In addition, the increasing deployment of connected devices and the implementation of IoT-based solutions in commercial and residential buildings, as well as the rising trend of automation, is expected to drive the market. Furthermore, the emergence of advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Network Analytics, and Building Automation systems are expected to contribute to the growth of this market.

Smart Building Automation Systems (SBAS) are computer-based systems for monitoring, controlling, and optimizing the performance of buildings and energy systems. These systems are capable of monitoring, controlling, and automating the temperature, lighting, security, and energy usage in buildings. The increasing demand for energy efficient and cost-effective solutions is driving the growth of the Global Smart Building Automation Systems Market.

The key drivers that are driving the Global Smart Building Automation Systems Market are increasing demand for energy efficiency, government initiatives promoting energy efficiency, increasing adoption of automation solutions in buildings, and growing demand for energy-saving technologies. On the other hand, the high cost of automation systems and lack of technical awareness in some countries are the restraints that are restraining the growth of the Global Smart Building Automation Systems Market.

In addition to these drivers and restraints, the Global Smart Building Automation Systems Market also provides opportunities for market players to leverage them. These opportunities include rising demand for wireless automation systems, increasing need for sustainable buildings, and increasing importance of integrated building management systems.

Our report on the Global Smart Building Automation Systems Market provides an in-depth analysis of the market size, share, drivers, restraints, opportunities, key players, and competitive landscape. It also includes insights from reputed sources such as industry experts, market research firms, and market analysts to provide the reader an accurate assessment of the market.

Growth driving factors of the Global Smart Building Automation Systems Market

Increasing demand for energy efficiency & sustainability: As the cost of energy is increasing, there is a growing demand for energy-efficient and sustainable solutions that can help reduce energy costs. Smart building automation systems provide an efficient way to manage and monitor energy consumption in buildings. These systems enable building owners to make better decisions that can reduce energy costs and improve sustainability.

Growing awareness and acceptance of smart building automation systems: As the need for energy efficiency and sustainability rises, so does the awareness and acceptance of smart building automation systems. These systems are becoming increasingly popular with building owners as they provide enhanced security, safety and better control over building systems. Additionally, the availability of low-cost sensors and controllers makes these systems more affordable and easy to integrate into existing building systems.

Increasing government initiatives and investments in smart building solutions

Growing demand for enhanced security and safety of buildings

Growing demand for increased automation and connectivity in building systems

Challenges Faced by Global Smart Building Automation Systems Market

High cost of installation and maintenance: The cost of installing and maintaining a smart building automation system can be expensive due to the nature of the components and infrastructure needed to ensure the system functions properly. This can significantly hinder the adoption of the technology, particularly among smaller businesses and organizations.

Lack of technical expertise: The installation and maintenance of a smart building automation system requires specialized knowledge and expertise, which many organizations lack. Without the right technical know-how, businesses may be unable to properly utilize the technology to achieve the desired results.

Security and privacy concerns

Complex regulatory framework

Lack of standardization

Global Smart Building Automation Systems Market Segment Insights

The Global Smart Building Automation Systems Market is segmented on the basis of Product/Type, Application, Technology, End-User

Segment Insights by Product/Type

Lighting Control Systems: Lighting control systems are automated systems used to control lighting in commercial and residential buildings. These systems are used to adjust lighting levels and energy consumption as needed, based on requirements such as time of day, occupancy, or light level. They typically use motion detectors, occupancy sensors, and other technology to optimize energy efficient lighting.

HVAC Control Systems: HVAC control systems are automated systems that are used to monitor and control temperature, humidity, and air quality in buildings. These systems allow for better comfort and energy efficiency by regulating temperature and airflow, as well as filtering out contaminants from the air. They can be programmed to run certain schedules or to respond to energy markets to maximize efficiency.

Security & Access Control Systems: Security and access control systems are automated systems used to monitor and control the security of building occupants, visitors, and equipment. These systems use a combination of sensors, cameras, and access control locks to provide both intrusion detection and entry control.

Building Management Systems: Building management systems are integrated systems used to control all aspects of a building’s operations. These systems allow users to monitor and control multiple building systems, including lighting, security, HVAC, and energy systems, at a single central control point.

Others:These include various other types of automated control systems such as audio-visual equipment controls, fire alarm systems, smoke control systems, thermostats and motors, outdoor weather protection systems, elevators, and window treatments.

Segment Insights by Application

Residential: Smart building automation systems for the residential sector enable the automation and control of various home solutions – for example security systems, energy-management systems, lighting control systems, and air-conditioning systems. These systems are designed to provide convenience, safety and energy savings to residences.

Commercial: Smart building automation systems for commercial applications offer a comprehensive portfolio of energy management, security, and lighting control solutions to meet the requirements of corporate, public and institutional facilities. The portfolios vary in complexity depending on building needs and budgets.

Industrial: Industrial smart building automation systems enable the integration of energy management, security, lighting control and HVAC/air-conditioning systems, as well as the automation of mechanical and electrical processes in factory and industrial buildings. These systems provide real-time monitoring and control, allowing for improved operations and energy savings.

Segment Insights by Technology

Wired: A wired building automation system is one that makes use of wired technology, typically in the form of control wiring that runs throughout the structure connecting sensors to the controllers. This type of system is typically highly reliable and secure, but installation costs can be quite high due to the labor involved in running the wiring.

Wireless:Wireless building automation systems rely on wireless communication to connect sensors and controllers. This type of system is more cost-effective as it does not require the installation of control wiring. Additionally, it offers greater flexibility in terms of placement of sensors and controllers. However, this type of system is not as reliable as a wired one since wireless signals can be blocked or disrupted.

Segment Insights by End-User

Real Estate Developers: Real estate developers play a key role in the global smart building automation systems market. They are responsible for transforming raw land into office blocks, residential flats and other commercial buildings that use automated systems for heating, cooling, lighting, ventilation, security and access management, amongst other tasks. Typically, they purchase automated systems for entire buildings, or for a group of buildings, or in a development site.

Building Owners & Operators: Building owners and operators form an integral part of the smart building automation systems market. They are responsible for the safe and efficient running of the building and maintaining and monitoring the automated systems, ensuring that they are kept in optimal working order and that any potential problems can be identified and addressed quickly. They usually purchase systems from system integrators and contractors, or source systems directly from automation systems manufacturers.

System Integrators & Contractors: System integrators and contractors are responsible for providing the integrated and automated systems that are used in smart building automation systems. They install the technology, integrate it into the existing building, maintain the automation systems, provide technical support, conduct regular system health checks and repairs, and provide customer service. System integrators and contractors are crucial for the successful functioning of automated smart buildings.
